00048 // Borrowed from Boost.Python library: determines the cases where we
00049 // need to use std::type_info::name to compare instead of operator==.
00050 # if (defined(__GNUC__) && __GNUC__ >= 3) \
00051  || defined(_AIX) \
00052  || (   defined(__sgi) && defined(__host_mips))
00053 #  include <cstring>
00054 #  define BOOST_FUNCTION_COMPARE_TYPE_ID(X,Y) \
00055      (std::strcmp((X).name(),(Y).name()) == 0)
00056 # else
00057 #  define BOOST_FUNCTION_COMPARE_TYPE_ID(X,Y) ((X)==(Y))
00058 #endif

00061 #  define BOOST_FUNCTION_TARGET_FIX(x) x
00062 #else
00063 #  define BOOST_FUNCTION_TARGET_FIX(x)
00064 #endif // not MSVC

00068 // boost::python::objects::function has to be seen by the compiler before the
00069 // boost::function class template.

00071   class function;

00131       union function_buffer
00132       {
00133         // For pointers to function objects
00134         void* obj_ptr;
00135 
00136         // For pointers to std::type_info objects
00137         // (get_functor_type_tag, check_functor_type_tag).
00138         const void* const_obj_ptr;
00139 
00140         // For function pointers of all kinds
00141         mutable void (*func_ptr)();
00142 
00143         // For bound member pointers
00144         struct bound_memfunc_ptr_t {
00145           void (X::*memfunc_ptr)(int);
00146           void* obj_ptr;
00147         } bound_memfunc_ptr;
00148 
00149         // To relax aliasing constraints
00150         mutable char data;
00151       };
00152 
00159       struct unusable
00160       {
00161         unusable() {}
00162         template<typename T> unusable(const T&) {}
00163       };
00164 
00165       /* Determine the return type. This supports compilers that do not support
00166        * void returns or partial specialization by silently changing the return
00167        * type to "unusable".
00168        */
00169       template<typename T> struct function_return_type { typedef T type; };
00170 
00171       template<>
00172       struct function_return_type<void>
00173       {
00174         typedef unusable type;
00175       };
00176 
00177       // The operation type to perform on the given functor/function pointer
00178       enum functor_manager_operation_type {
00179         clone_functor_tag,
00180         destroy_functor_tag,
00181         check_functor_type_tag,
00182         get_functor_type_tag
00183       };
00184 
00185       // Tags used to decide between different types of functions
00186       struct function_ptr_tag {};
00187       struct function_obj_tag {};
00188       struct member_ptr_tag {};
00189       struct function_obj_ref_tag {};
00190 
00191       template<typename F>
00192       class get_function_tag
00193       {
00194         typedef typename mpl::if_c<(is_pointer<F>::value),
00195                                    function_ptr_tag,
00196                                    function_obj_tag>::type ptr_or_obj_tag;
00197 
00198         typedef typename mpl::if_c<(is_member_pointer<F>::value),
00199                                    member_ptr_tag,
00200                                    ptr_or_obj_tag>::type ptr_or_obj_or_mem_tag;
00201 
00202         typedef typename mpl::if_c<(is_reference_wrapper<F>::value),
00203                                    function_obj_ref_tag,
00204                                    ptr_or_obj_or_mem_tag>::type or_ref_tag;
00205 
00206       public:
00207         typedef or_ref_tag type;
00208       };
00209 
00210       // The trivial manager does nothing but return the same pointer (if we
00211       // are cloning) or return the null pointer (if we are deleting).
00212       template<typename F>
00213       struct reference_manager
00214       {
00215         static inline void
00216         manage(const function_buffer& in_buffer, function_buffer& out_buffer, 
00217                functor_manager_operation_type op)
00218         {
00219           switch (op) {
00220           case clone_functor_tag: 
00221             out_buffer.obj_ptr = in_buffer.obj_ptr;
00222             return;
00223 
00224           case destroy_functor_tag:
00225             out_buffer.obj_ptr = 0;
00226             return;
00227 
00228           case check_functor_type_tag:
00229             {
00230               // DPG TBD: Since we're only storing a pointer, it's
00231               // possible that the user could ask for a base class or
00232               // derived class. Is that okay?
00233               const BOOST_FUNCTION_STD_NS::type_info& check_type = 
00234                 *static_cast<const BOOST_FUNCTION_STD_NS::type_info*>(out_buffer.const_obj_ptr);
00235               if (BOOST_FUNCTION_COMPARE_TYPE_ID(check_type, typeid(F)))
00236                 out_buffer.obj_ptr = in_buffer.obj_ptr;
00237               else
00238                 out_buffer.obj_ptr = 0;
00239             }
00240             return;
00241 
00242           case get_functor_type_tag:
00243             out_buffer.const_obj_ptr = &typeid(F);
00244             return;
00245           }
00246         }
00247       };
00248 
00253       template<typename F>
00254       struct function_allows_small_object_optimization
00255       {
00256         BOOST_STATIC_CONSTANT
00257           (bool, 
00258            value = ((sizeof(F) <= sizeof(function_buffer) &&
00259                      (alignment_of<function_buffer>::value 
00260                       % alignment_of<F>::value == 0))));
00261       };
00262 
00267       template<typename Functor, typename Allocator>
00268       struct functor_manager
00269       {
00270       private:
00271         typedef Functor functor_type;
00272 
00273         // For function pointers, the manager is trivial
00274         static inline void
00275         manager(const function_buffer& in_buffer, function_buffer& out_buffer, 
00276                 functor_manager_operation_type op, function_ptr_tag)
00277         {
00278           if (op == clone_functor_tag)
00279             out_buffer.func_ptr = in_buffer.func_ptr;
00280           else if (op == destroy_functor_tag)
00281             out_buffer.func_ptr = 0;
00282           else /* op == check_functor_type_tag */ {
00283             const BOOST_FUNCTION_STD_NS::type_info& check_type = 
00284               *static_cast<const BOOST_FUNCTION_STD_NS::type_info*>(out_buffer.const_obj_ptr);
00285             if (BOOST_FUNCTION_COMPARE_TYPE_ID(check_type, typeid(Functor)))
00286               out_buffer.obj_ptr = &in_buffer.func_ptr;
00287             else
00288               out_buffer.obj_ptr = 0;
00289           }
00290         }
00291 
00292         // Function objects that fit in the small-object buffer.
00293         static inline void
00294         manager(const function_buffer& in_buffer, function_buffer& out_buffer, 
00295                 functor_manager_operation_type op, mpl::true_)
00296         {
00297           if (op == clone_functor_tag) {
00298             const functor_type* in_functor = 
00299               reinterpret_cast<const functor_type*>(&in_buffer.data);
00300             new ((void*)&out_buffer.data) functor_type(*in_functor);
00301           } else if (op == destroy_functor_tag) {
00302             // Some compilers (Borland, vc6, ...) are unhappy with ~functor_type.
00303             reinterpret_cast<functor_type*>(&out_buffer.data)->~Functor();
00304           } else /* op == check_functor_type_tag */ {
00305             const BOOST_FUNCTION_STD_NS::type_info& check_type = 
00306               *static_cast<const BOOST_FUNCTION_STD_NS::type_info*>(out_buffer.const_obj_ptr);
00307             if (BOOST_FUNCTION_COMPARE_TYPE_ID(check_type, typeid(Functor)))
00308               out_buffer.obj_ptr = &in_buffer.data;
00309             else
00310               out_buffer.obj_ptr = 0;
00311           }
00312         }
00313         
00314         // Function objects that require heap allocation
00315         static inline void
00316         manager(const function_buffer& in_buffer, function_buffer& out_buffer, 
00317                 functor_manager_operation_type op, mpl::false_)
00318         {
00319 #ifndef BOOST_NO_STD_ALLOCATOR
00320           typedef typename Allocator::template rebind<functor_type>::other
00321             allocator_type;
00322           typedef typename allocator_type::pointer pointer_type;
00323 #else
00324           typedef functor_type* pointer_type;
00325 #endif // BOOST_NO_STD_ALLOCATOR
00326 
00327 #  ifndef BOOST_NO_STD_ALLOCATOR
00328           allocator_type allocator;
00329 #  endif // BOOST_NO_STD_ALLOCATOR
00330 
00331           if (op == clone_functor_tag) {
00332             // GCC 2.95.3 gets the CV qualifiers wrong here, so we
00333             // can't do the static_cast that we should do.
00334             const functor_type* f =
00335               (const functor_type*)(in_buffer.obj_ptr);
00336 
00337             // Clone the functor
00338 #  ifndef BOOST_NO_STD_ALLOCATOR
00339             pointer_type copy = allocator.allocate(1);
00340             allocator.construct(copy, *f);
00341 
00342             // Get back to the original pointer type
00343             functor_type* new_f = static_cast<functor_type*>(copy);
00344 #  else
00345             functor_type* new_f = new functor_type(*f);
00346 #  endif // BOOST_NO_STD_ALLOCATOR
00347             out_buffer.obj_ptr = new_f;
00348           } else if (op == destroy_functor_tag) {
00349             /* Cast from the void pointer to the functor pointer type */
00350             functor_type* f =
00351               static_cast<functor_type*>(out_buffer.obj_ptr);
00352 
00353 #  ifndef BOOST_NO_STD_ALLOCATOR
00354             /* Cast from the functor pointer type to the allocator's pointer
00355                type */
00356             pointer_type victim = static_cast<pointer_type>(f);
00357 
00358             // Destroy and deallocate the functor
00359             allocator.destroy(victim);
00360             allocator.deallocate(victim, 1);
00361 #  else
00362             delete f;
00363 #  endif // BOOST_NO_STD_ALLOCATOR
00364             out_buffer.obj_ptr = 0;
00365           } else /* op == check_functor_type_tag */ {
00366             const BOOST_FUNCTION_STD_NS::type_info& check_type = 
00367               *static_cast<const BOOST_FUNCTION_STD_NS::type_info*>(out_buffer.const_obj_ptr);
00368             if (BOOST_FUNCTION_COMPARE_TYPE_ID(check_type, typeid(Functor)))
00369               out_buffer.obj_ptr = in_buffer.obj_ptr;
00370             else
00371               out_buffer.obj_ptr = 0;
00372           }
00373         }
00374 
00375         // For function objects, we determine whether the function
00376         // object can use the small-object optimization buffer or
00377         // whether we need to allocate it on the heap.
00378         static inline void
00379         manager(const function_buffer& in_buffer, function_buffer& out_buffer, 
00380                 functor_manager_operation_type op, function_obj_tag)
00381         {
00382           manager(in_buffer, out_buffer, op,
00383                   mpl::bool_<(function_allows_small_object_optimization<functor_type>::value)>());
00384         }
00385 
00386         // For member pointers, we treat them as function objects with
00387         // the small-object optimization always enabled.
00388         static inline void
00389         manager(const function_buffer& in_buffer, function_buffer& out_buffer, 
00390                 functor_manager_operation_type op, member_ptr_tag)
00391         {
00392           manager(in_buffer, out_buffer, op, mpl::true_());
00393         }
00394 
00395       public:
00396         /* Dispatch to an appropriate manager based on whether we have a
00397            function pointer or a function object pointer. */
00398         static inline void
00399         manage(const function_buffer& in_buffer, function_buffer& out_buffer, 
00400                functor_manager_operation_type op)
00401         {
00402           typedef typename get_function_tag<functor_type>::type tag_type;
00403           switch (op) {
00404           case get_functor_type_tag:
00405             out_buffer.const_obj_ptr = &typeid(functor_type);
00406             return;
00407 
00408           default:
00409             manager(in_buffer, out_buffer, op, tag_type());
00410             return;
00411           }
00412         }
00413       };
00414 
00415       // A type that is only used for comparisons against zero
00416       struct useless_clear_type {};
00417 
00418 #ifdef BOOST_NO_SFINAE
00419       // These routines perform comparisons between a Boost.Function
00420       // object and an arbitrary function object (when the last
00421       // parameter is mpl::bool_<false>) or against zero (when the
00422       // last parameter is mpl::bool_<true>). They are only necessary
00423       // for compilers that don't support SFINAE.
00424       template<typename Function, typename Functor>
00425         bool
00426         compare_equal(const Function& f, const Functor&, int, mpl::bool_<true>)
00427         { return f.empty(); }
00428 
00429       template<typename Function, typename Functor>
00430         bool
00431         compare_not_equal(const Function& f, const Functor&, int,
00432                           mpl::bool_<true>)
00433         { return !f.empty(); }
00434 
00435       template<typename Function, typename Functor>
00436         bool
00437         compare_equal(const Function& f, const Functor& g, long,
00438                       mpl::bool_<false>)
00439         {
00440           if (const Functor* fp = f.template target<Functor>())
00441             return function_equal(*fp, g);
00442           else return false;
00443         }
00444 
00445       template<typename Function, typename Functor>
00446         bool
00447         compare_equal(const Function& f, const reference_wrapper<Functor>& g,
00448                       int, mpl::bool_<false>)
00449         {
00450           if (const Functor* fp = f.template target<Functor>())
00451             return fp == g.get_pointer();
00452           else return false;
00453         }
00454 
00455       template<typename Function, typename Functor>
00456         bool
00457         compare_not_equal(const Function& f, const Functor& g, long,
00458                           mpl::bool_<false>)
00459         {
00460           if (const Functor* fp = f.template target<Functor>())
00461             return !function_equal(*fp, g);
00462           else return true;
00463         }
00464 
00465       template<typename Function, typename Functor>
00466         bool
00467         compare_not_equal(const Function& f,
00468                           const reference_wrapper<Functor>& g, int,
00469                           mpl::bool_<false>)
00470         {
00471           if (const Functor* fp = f.template target<Functor>())
00472             return fp != g.get_pointer();
00473           else return true;
00474         }
00475 #endif // BOOST_NO_SFINAE

00481       struct vtable_base
00482       {
00483         void (*manager)(const function_buffer& in_buffer, 
00484                         function_buffer& out_buffer, 
00485                         functor_manager_operation_type op);
00486       };
00487     } // end namespace function
00488   } // end namespace detail
00489 
00496 class function_base
00497 {
00498 public:
00499   function_base() : vtable(0) { }
00500 
00502   bool empty() const { return !vtable; }
00503 
00506   const BOOST_FUNCTION_STD_NS::type_info& target_type() const
00507   {
00508     if (!vtable) return typeid(void);
00509 
00510     detail::function::function_buffer type;
00511     vtable->manager(functor, type, detail::function::get_functor_type_tag);
00512     return *static_cast<const BOOST_FUNCTION_STD_NS::type_info*>(type.const_obj_ptr);
00513   }
00514 
00515   template<typename Functor>
00516     Functor* target()
00517     {
00518       if (!vtable) return 0;
00519 
00520       detail::function::function_buffer type_result;
00521       type_result.const_obj_ptr = &typeid(Functor);
00522       vtable->manager(functor, type_result, 
00523                       detail::function::check_functor_type_tag);
00524       return static_cast<Functor*>(type_result.obj_ptr);
00525     }
00526 
00527   template<typename Functor>
00528 #if defined(BOOST_MSVC) && BOOST_WORKAROUND(BOOST_MSVC, < 1300)
00529     const Functor* target( Functor * = 0 ) const
00530 #else
00531     const Functor* target() const
00532 #endif
00533     {
00534       if (!vtable) return 0;
00535 
00536       detail::function::function_buffer type_result;
00537       type_result.const_obj_ptr = &typeid(Functor);
00538       vtable->manager(functor, type_result, 
00539                       detail::function::check_functor_type_tag);
00540       // GCC 2.95.3 gets the CV qualifiers wrong here, so we
00541       // can't do the static_cast that we should do.
00542       return (const Functor*)(type_result.obj_ptr);
00543     }
00544 
00545   template<typename F>
00546     bool contains(const F& f) const
00547     {
00548 #if defined(BOOST_MSVC) && BOOST_WORKAROUND(BOOST_MSVC, < 1300)
00549       if (const F* fp = this->target( (F*)0 ))
00550 #else
00551       if (const F* fp = this->template target<F>())
00552 #endif
00553       {
00554         return function_equal(*fp, f);
00555       } else {
00556         return false;
00557       }
00558     }
00559 
00560 #if defined(__GNUC__) && __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ <= 3
00561   // GCC 3.3 and newer cannot copy with the global operator==, due to
00562   // problems with instantiation of function return types before it
00563   // has been verified that the argument types match up.
00564   template<typename Functor>
00565     BOOST_FUNCTION_ENABLE_IF_NOT_INTEGRAL(Functor, bool)
00566     operator==(Functor g) const
00567     {
00568       if (const Functor* fp = target<Functor>())
00569         return function_equal(*fp, g);
00570       else return false;
00571     }
00572 
00573   template<typename Functor>
00574     BOOST_FUNCTION_ENABLE_IF_NOT_INTEGRAL(Functor, bool)
00575     operator!=(Functor g) const
00576     {
00577       if (const Functor* fp = target<Functor>())
00578         return !function_equal(*fp, g);
00579       else return true;
00580     }
00581 #endif
00582 
00583 public: // should be protected, but GCC 2.95.3 will fail to allow access
00584   const detail::function::vtable_base* vtable;
00585   mutable detail::function::function_buffer functor;
00586 };

00592 class bad_function_call : public std::runtime_error
00593 {
00594 public:
00595   bad_function_call() : std::runtime_error("call to empty boost::function") {}
00596 };

00598 #ifndef BOOST_NO_SFINAE
00599 inline bool operator==(const function_base& f,
00600                        detail::function::useless_clear_type*)
00601 {
00602   return f.empty();
00603 }
00604 
00605 inline bool operator!=(const function_base& f,
00606                        detail::function::useless_clear_type*)
00607 {
00608   return !f.empty();
00609 }
00610 
00611 inline bool operator==(detail::function::useless_clear_type*,
00612                        const function_base& f)
00613 {
00614   return f.empty();
00615 }
00616 
00617 inline bool operator!=(detail::function::useless_clear_type*,
00618                        const function_base& f)
00619 {
00620   return !f.empty();
00621 }
00622 #endif

00624 #ifdef BOOST_NO_SFINAE
00625 // Comparisons between boost::function objects and arbitrary function objects
00626 template<typename Functor>
00627   inline bool operator==(const function_base& f, Functor g)
00628   {
00629     typedef mpl::bool_<(is_integral<Functor>::value)> integral;
00630     return detail::function::compare_equal(f, g, 0, integral());
00631   }
00632 
00633 template<typename Functor>
00634   inline bool operator==(Functor g, const function_base& f)
00635   {
00636     typedef mpl::bool_<(is_integral<Functor>::value)> integral;
00637     return detail::function::compare_equal(f, g, 0, integral());
00638   }
00639 
00640 template<typename Functor>
00641   inline bool operator!=(const function_base& f, Functor g)
00642   {
00643     typedef mpl::bool_<(is_integral<Functor>::value)> integral;
00644     return detail::function::compare_not_equal(f, g, 0, integral());
00645   }
00646 
00647 template<typename Functor>
00648   inline bool operator!=(Functor g, const function_base& f)
00649   {
00650     typedef mpl::bool_<(is_integral<Functor>::value)> integral;
00651     return detail::function::compare_not_equal(f, g, 0, integral());
00652   }
00653 #else
00654 
00655 #  if !(defined(__GNUC__) && __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ <= 3)
00656 // Comparisons between boost::function objects and arbitrary function
00657 // objects. GCC 3.3 and before has an obnoxious bug that prevents this
00658 // from working.
00659 template<typename Functor>
00660   BOOST_FUNCTION_ENABLE_IF_NOT_INTEGRAL(Functor, bool)
00661   operator==(const function_base& f, Functor g)
00662   {
00663     if (const Functor* fp = f.template target<Functor>())
00664       return function_equal(*fp, g);
00665     else return false;
00666   }
00667 
00668 template<typename Functor>
00669   BOOST_FUNCTION_ENABLE_IF_NOT_INTEGRAL(Functor, bool)
00670   operator==(Functor g, const function_base& f)
00671   {
00672     if (const Functor* fp = f.template target<Functor>())
00673       return function_equal(g, *fp);
00674     else return false;
00675   }

00677 template<typename Functor>
00678   BOOST_FUNCTION_ENABLE_IF_NOT_INTEGRAL(Functor, bool)
00679   operator!=(const function_base& f, Functor g)
00680   {
00681     if (const Functor* fp = f.template target<Functor>())
00682       return !function_equal(*fp, g);
00683     else return true;
00684   }

00689   {
00690     if (const Functor* fp = f.template target<Functor>())
00691       return !function_equal(g, *fp);
00692     else return true;
00693   }

00696 template<typename Functor>
00697   BOOST_FUNCTION_ENABLE_IF_NOT_INTEGRAL(Functor, bool)
00698   operator==(const function_base& f, reference_wrapper<Functor> g)
00699   {
00700     if (const Functor* fp = f.template target<Functor>())
00701       return fp == g.get_pointer();
00702     else return false;
00703   }
00704 
00705 template<typename Functor>
00706   BOOST_FUNCTION_ENABLE_IF_NOT_INTEGRAL(Functor, bool)
00707   operator==(reference_wrapper<Functor> g, const function_base& f)
00708   {
00709     if (const Functor* fp = f.template target<Functor>())
00710       return g.get_pointer() == fp;
00711     else return false;
00712   }
00713 
00714 template<typename Functor>
00715   BOOST_FUNCTION_ENABLE_IF_NOT_INTEGRAL(Functor, bool)
00716   operator!=(const function_base& f, reference_wrapper<Functor> g)
00717   {
00718     if (const Functor* fp = f.template target<Functor>())
00719       return fp != g.get_pointer();
00720     else return true;
00721   }
00722 
00723 template<typename Functor>
00724   BOOST_FUNCTION_ENABLE_IF_NOT_INTEGRAL(Functor, bool)
00725   operator!=(reference_wrapper<Functor> g, const function_base& f)
00726   {
00727     if (const Functor* fp = f.template target<Functor>())
00728       return g.get_pointer() != fp;
00729     else return true;
00730   }

00732 #endif // Compiler supporting SFINAE

00734 namespace detail {
00735   namespace function {
00736     inline bool has_empty_target(const function_base* f)
00737     {
00738       return f->empty();
00739     }
00740 
00741 #if BOOST_WORKAROUND(BOOST_MSVC, <= 1310)
00742     inline bool has_empty_target(const void*)
00743     {
00744       return false;
00745     }
00746 #else
00747     inline bool has_empty_target(...)
00748     {
00749       return false;
00750     }
00751 #endif
00752   } // end namespace function
